result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas J Haber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: sentence defendant currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall not associate with known drug users or be present where drugs are illegally purchased/sold/conumed. Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; defendant shall submit to random breath/blood/urine screens to determine complaince.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including AODA assessment/treatment. Defendant shall maintain full-time employment and/or school. Defendant shall maintain a stable residence.  Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
